We now list some properties of matrix multiplication and compare them with corresponding properties for multiplication of numbers.

Key Point

\( \begin{array}{ccc} \textbf{Matrix algebra} && \textbf{Number algebra} \\ A(B+C) = AB+AC && a(b+c)=ab+ac \\ AB\neq BA\text{ in general} && ab=ba \\ A(BC)=(AB)C && a(bc)=(ab)c \\ AI = IA = A && 1\cdot a=a\cdot1=a \\ A\underline{0} = \underline{0}A=\underline{0} && 0\cdot a=a\cdot0=0 \\ AB\text{ may not be defined} && ab\text{ is always defined} \\ AB=\underline{0}\text{ does not imply }A=\underline{0}\text{ or }B=\underline{0} && ab=0\text{ implies }a=0\text{ or }b=0 \end{array} \)
